1.text: Use an 8.5 by 11 in (22 by 28 cm) sheet of printer paper.

2.text: Fold the bottom fourth of your paper up.

3.text: Fold another 2.5 inches (64 mm) of the paper up.

4.text: Flip your paper over and fold it in half.

5.text: Grab the popper at the back tip of the folded bar on the top of your paper.

6.text: Make sure you’re not pinching any of the unfolded portions of the paper.

8.text: Get a piece of 8.5 by 11 in (22 by 28 cm) printer paper.

9.text: Create creases on the paper to use as guides.

10.text: Fold each corner of the paper inward.

11.text: Fold the popper in half to create a trapezoid shape.

12.text: Fold up the left and right corners.

15.text: Use an 8.5 by 11 in (22 by 28 cm) sheet of printer paper.

16.text: Fold the paper in half lengthwise on a horizontal crease.

17.text: Fold the paper in half again.

18.text: Pinch the two inner flaps on the bottom of your paper with one hand.

19.text: Pinch the two outer flaps with your other hand.
